programme.title: Extremes S1 - "Physics, Space and Wealth"
programme.desc: In this episode of Extremes, we’ll explore all things extreme in physics, space and wealth plus take a look at the smallest creatures on Earth.

programme.title: Science of Sound S1 - "Power of Nostalgia"
programme.desc: Music has the power to transport us back in time. Marty Music sat down with Nicole Richard, a neurologic music therapist, and professor from Belmont University to talk about how music affects our brains and stirs up memories.

programme.title: Dictators' Hideouts S1 - "Mussolini's Underground Refuge"
programme.desc: 50 km north of Rome lies the greatest hideout in fascist Italy’s history: The Monte Soratte Bunker, with security features even a Bond villain could only dream of.

programme.title: Space Greed S1 - "Mad Scientists In Outer Space"
programme.desc: The unique properties of space make it ideal for some world-changing and unique scientific experiments.

programme.title: Space Greed S1 - "Space As A Tax Haven"
programme.desc: For the ultra-wealthy, the best part of making money is avoiding taxes. Space could be an astronomical payday, but will all that profit slip by tax free?

programme.title: Space Greed S1 - "Traveling So Fast Time Slows Down"
programme.sub-title: Traveling So Fast Time Slows Down
programme.desc: When we start thinking about traveling at speeds close to the speed of light, our perception of time’s passing starts to get pretty mind-bending.

programme.title: Strange World S1 - "Ice Bombs"
programme.desc: Alex heads to America search of a scientific explanation for the terrifying phenomenon known as Ice Bombs, which cause fear, devastation and even injury.

programme.title: Science of Sound S1 - "Sticky Lyrics"
programme.desc: Have you ever gotten a song stuck in your head? Marty Music sat down with Dr. Carole Scherling, a neuroscientist from Belmont University, to talk all about sticky lyrics and the science behind why some catchy tunes get stuck in our heads.

programme.title: Space Greed S1 - "Space Pirates"
programme.desc: Between advanced satellites and tons of precious resources the future of space exploration looks to be highly profitable.

programme.title: Breakthrough S1 - "Fusion: Harnessing the Power of Stars"
programme.sub-title: Fusion: Harnessing the Power of Stars
programme.desc: Humanity is closer than ever before to a perpetual clean power source after a team of scientists at Lawrence Livermore National Laboratory successfully produced a nuclear fusion reaction resulting in a net energy gain.

programme.title: Space Greed S1 - "Declaring Martian Law"
programme.desc: Space is home to crucial resources, important discoveries, and big potential profit.

programme.title: Space Greed S1 - "Sol Ownership: Can A Corporation Own The Sun?"
programme.sub-title: Sol Ownership: Can A Corporation Own The Sun?
programme.desc: Human needs have always created opportunities for human greed. And energy might be the most crucial need of all. Could we end up paying a subscription fee for sunlight?

programme.title: The Re-Inventors S3 - "Syrian Torpedo"
programme.desc: Today we will see what happens when you combine traditional blacksmithing, gunpowder and water.

programme.title: Ancient Engineering S2 - "Earliest Arenas: The Colosseum"
programme.desc: Since their earliest existence in ancient Greek and Roman civilizations, stadiums have been regarded as achitectural masterpieces and focal poins in their surrounding cities, but none more so than the Colosseum in Rome.

programme.title: Ancient Engineering S2 - "How Gold Changed The World"
programme.desc: Join us as we dig deep in this episode to uncover how gold was mined and transformed into everyday objects like jewellery and currency, and even to adorn holy temples and statues.

programme.title: Ancient Engineering S2 - "History's Deadliest Weapons"
programme.desc: As the battle distance continued to grow with each new weapon, humans put their best minds to work refining and evolving their designs over the millenia to gain the upper hand.

programme.title: Extremes S1 - "Tall Buildings, Fast Animals and Expensive Cities"
programme.sub-title: Tall Buildings, Fast Animals and Expensive Cities
programme.desc: In this episode of Extremes, we explore tall buildings, fast animals, expensive cities and extremely impressive basketball records.

programme.title: The Flying Kestrel S2 - "The Test"
programme.desc: The new version of the Flying Kestrel is ready to be put to the test at one of the most state of the art wind tunnels. Has the team done enough to create a record-breaking car?

programme.title: Hollywood Weapons: Fact or Fiction? S6 - "We Do It For You"
programme.desc: We go to the mail room for viewer requests as Terry and Larry take a look into famous scenes from Yellowstone, SWAT, Fast and Furious.

programme.title: Hollywood Weapons: Fact or Fiction? S6 - "Leftovers Again?"
programme.desc: Terry and Larry test things they never got to from other episodes. Pull up a chair and get ready for leftovers, and a surprise guest!

programme.title: Hollywood Weapons: Fact or Fiction? S6 - "Punishing Larry"
programme.desc: Grenades, propane tanks, and a bathtub, all adds up to some big tests of the popular comic book character.

programme.title: Hollywood Weapons: Fact or Fiction? S6 - "Terry Loves Action Movies"
programme.desc: From Polar, to James Bond, the Lethal Weapon, Terry loves action movies and is putting some of the best ones to the test!

programme.title: Earthrise S1 - "Winds Of Change"
programme.desc: Earthrise travels to India and Denmark, to explore two innovative movements that are helping to drive down green-house gas emissions.

programme.title: Earthrise S1 - "Human-Wildlife Conflict"
programme.desc: Earthrise travels to Bangladesh and Australia, to visit two projects that have found ways for humans and animals to live better together on our shared planet.

programme.title: Earthrise S1 - "Life After Conflict"
programme.desc: We explore the environmental consequences of war and how different people, from Rohingya refugees to Syrian scientists, are trying to restore a healthy relationship with nature.

programme.title: Earthrise S1 - "Feeding The Billions"
programme.desc: We explore potential new strategies to satisfy the growing food demand, from restaurants growing potatoes in the air to jellyfish as a potential sustainable meat alternative.

programme.title: Digits S1 - "Connecting to the Future"
programme.desc: Muller escorts viewers to the physical heart of the Internet, revealing the very first message sent by UCLA professor Leonard Kleinrock, and demonstrating how Internet co-creators Vint Cerf and Bob Kahn devised a common protocol language.

programme.title: Digits S1 - "Man vs. Machine"
programme.desc: Get a sneak peek into how the Internet of Things will soon dominate daily life. As Edward Snowden provocatively points out, “TV is a medium that you watch. The Internet is a medium that watches you as you watch it.”

programme.title: Digits S1 - "Guardians of the Web"
programme.desc: Explore how our reliance on the web creates vulnerability to everything from cyber theft to an Internet system failure. Muller introduces viewers to “white hat” hackers, the U.S. Secret Service’s cybercrime division and even West Point soldiers.

programme.title: The New Frontier S4 - "Cubesat"
programme.desc: Cubesats the tiny Satellites are growing in main stream popularity, they have even been sent to Mars with the Insight Mission.

programme.title: The New Frontier S4 - "Proving Einstein"
programme.desc: Some of the proof of Einstein’s theories had long been elusive, beyond the capabilities of technology, until now. It appears that Einstein is once again triumphant with the latest in deep space observations.

programme.title: The New Frontier S4 - "Where Are All the Aliens?"
programme.desc: We’re looking hard, but the numbers aren’t stacking up, is life on other planets that hard to find? Even signals from an advanced race elude us. Maybe we really are alone in our neck of the galaxy!

programme.title: The New Frontier S5 - "Star Light, Star Bright"
programme.desc: The two current science missions to our star; the sun have made great leaps forward in the science of how stars work, how they generate solar winds and how they affect their orbiting planets. This lets us look at other stars with great understanding.

programme.title: How Do They Do It S14 - "Ford Transits, Driza-bone, Saltfish"
programme.desc: How do Ford produce the ubiquitous white van, the Transit? Plus, how do they ensure the Driza-bone coat lives up to its name?

programme.title: How Do They Do It S14 - "Wood Stoves, Indigo, Synthesiser"
programme.desc: How do they make wood burning stoves that bring warmth to the bleak Norwegian winter? Plus, how do build the synthesiser that changed music forever?

programme.title: How Do They Do It S14 - "Morgan Cars, Bamboo Cotton, Toilets"
programme.desc: How do they assemble the reinvented Morgan 3 Wheeler? Plus, how do they protect firefighters' hands from heat, flame and chemical attack?

programme.title: How Do They Do It S14 - "Wind Turbines, Car Tyres, Mushrooms"
programme.desc: How do they make wind turbines with twice the wingspan of a Boeing? Plus, how do they mould car tyres from the ooze of a tree?

programme.title: Past, Present, Future S1 - "...of Sports"
programme.desc: Sports and competitions have always been a core aspect of humanity’s development. While modern sports are evolving thanks to technology, the line between digital and reality has become blurry.

programme.title: Past, Present, Future S1 - "...of Food"
programme.desc: Large factory farms produce food for the masses with one caveat; they’re terrible for the environment. In an attempt to remedy this, chefs and scientists are working together to create a future where what we eat is as sustainable as it is delicious.

programme.title: Past, Present, Future S1 - "...of Comedy"
programme.desc: Comedy has always been a way for people to make sense of the world around them. As the world gets more complicated, how will comedy continue to evolve?

programme.title: Past, Present, Future S1 - "...of Hallucinogens"
programme.desc: While psychedelics were originally seen as a tool for spiritual enlightenment and healing, new research and studies are revisiting psychedelics to reveal their potential clinical and therapeutic impact.

programme.title: Bright Now S1 - "Antarctica Science Below Zero"
programme.desc: Antarctica is a mysterious and unexplored continent. Thanks to the Chilean Antarctic Institute and the research center Dynamics of Marine Ecosystems of High Altitudes, scientists are suffering the extreme temperatures to study climate change.

programme.title: Bright Now S1 - "Last American Slave Ship"
programme.desc: The final ship to bring slaves to the United States has been hidden in the swamps of Mobile, Alabama for generations.

programme.title: Bright Now S1 - "Raising a Genius"
programme.desc: Every child has a gift, and all of us as humen beings have a contribution that we can make to society, and we just have to find what that is. But what does it take to create a genius? What should the education of a genius look like?

programme.title: Bright Now S1 - "Can You Learn to Be Funny?"
programme.sub-title: Can You Learn to Be Funny?
programme.desc: What do you get when you cross a clown teacher, a comedian and neuroscientist? Suprising new insights about what it takes to be funny?

programme.title: Life of Cards S1 - "Joe Hachem"
programme.desc: Joe Hachem, Australian poker hero, fights for victory at the Aussie Millions while building a family imperium to give room to the next generation.

programme.title: Strange World S1 - "Alien Sounds"
programme.desc: Mysterious, alien sky sounds terrify Canadian residents, who struggle to locate their source.
